String.Source: What did you just hit me with? You can't change perfection.
String.Dest: 你刚刚用什么东西打了我一下？你不能改一改吗。

String.Source: Go ahead. Have your fun. I'm still as incredible as ever.
String.Dest: 继续吧。你高兴就好。我还是一如既往的了不起。

String.Source: Too much magnificence for you to handle, huh. I get that a lot.
String.Dest: 对你来说太过华丽了，哼嗯。这种场面我见多了。

String.Source: Why are you depriving yourself of all this?
String.Dest: 为什么你要让自己失去这一切？

String.Source: This better not be permanent. The wolf in me's been known to overreact.
String.Dest: 这最好别是永久的。我身体里的那头狼就是因反应过度而闻名的。

String.Source: Trouble ahead. I probably shouldn't have drank that last health potion.
String.Dest: 要有麻烦了。也许我之前不应该喝掉最后一瓶治疗药水。

String.Source: That's an impressive sight. Worthy of being baptized by my eyes, and chronicled by my song.
String.Dest: 真是令人叹为观止。值得被我目颂与传唱。

String.Source: Caves. Good hideout for bandits. Or Bretons.
String.Dest: 山洞。对强盗来说真是个完美的藏身处。当然还有布莱顿人。

String.Source: I met a Dwemer once. Sure I was drunk and couldn't tell a troll from a tadpole, but the point was I believed him, and my beliefs are infallible.
String.Dest: 我遇见过一个矮人！虽然当时我醉的恐怕连巨魔和蝌蚪都分不清，可重点是我相信了他，而我相信的东西是从来不会错的！

String.Source: These Nord ruins have stood for thousands of years. Which is just about all I can say it has going for it.
String.Dest: 这些诺德遗迹经历了千年的风霜，我能说的仅仅是……让我们进去吧。

String.Source: Hello.
String.Dest: 哈啰。

String.Source: Hello.
String.Dest: 你好。

String.Source: Here. I got this for you. Just a small token of my gratitude.
String.Dest: 来，这个送给你，只是个表达我心意的小礼物。

String.Source: I will perform a song you may not have heard before, but alas, it is not mine to claim. This song is called, "The Wolves of Jorrvaskr."
String.Dest: 接下来会是一首你从未听过的歌曲，不过，唉，它并不出自于我之手。这首歌的歌名是：“月瓦斯卡群狼”

String.Source: The Wolf strode upon great Jorrvaskr, to meet the sons of Ysgramor;
String.Dest: 【歌词待校对】这条狼大步踏入伟大的月瓦斯卡，去寻找伊斯格拉谟之子;

String.Source: They said what are you but a harbinger, to leave us hopeless and forlorn;
String.Dest: 他们说，你就是一个把我们弃于绝望与无助的预言者。

String.Source: The Wolf bore its fangs and spread its claws, and tore at its own hide;
String.Dest: 【歌词待校对】那匹狼张开利爪亮出獠牙，然后撕下了它自己的皮。

String.Source: Drink the blood, and become my sons, or by dawn you'll not survive;
String.Dest: 【歌词待校对】喝下这血，成为我的孩子吧。否则在黎明到来之时你将无法活下去 。

String.Source: And so the pack was born again as the Wolves of Jorrvaskr;
String.Dest: 【歌词待校对】于是他们作为月瓦斯卡之狼群重获新生。

String.Source: To rule in life and serve in death, as the moonlight bound hunter.
String.Dest: 生为万物之主，死为吾神之仆，是为月影位面之仆从。

String.Source: (End Song)
String.Dest: （结束歌曲）

String.Source: (End Song)
String.Dest: (歌曲结束)

String.Source: I know what I deserve, Zora. Gold. Women. But right now, I'll settle for a warm fire, a sturdy bench, and your hands where I can see them.
String.Dest: 我知道什么是我应得的，佐拉。金子，和女人。但现在，能有一蔟温暖的篝火，一个坚固的凳子，并且把你的手放在我可以看见的地方，我就知足了。

String.Source: Keep your distance Breton. I know how your people operate. First you play nice, but it's only a matter of time before you demand a duel.
String.Dest: 站远点儿布莱顿人。我知道你们这些人玩的哪套。一开始你们会巧言令色，但用不了多久你们就会刀剑相向了。

String.Source: Orphan Rock. It'll likely be a perilous undertaking. We may not survive.
String.Dest: 孤儿岩，恐怕是个很危险的活儿。我们未必能活着回来。

String.Source: Life is full of perilous undertakings. It's like bedding a large woman. Scary as it sounds, sometimes it's worth it just to say you've done it.
String.Dest: 人生中充满着危险的任务。就像和一个大胖妞上床一样。听起来很恐怖，但能完成这样一件”壮举“，就已经很值得了。

String.Source: Orphan Rock. It'll likely be a perilous undertaking. We may not survive.
String.Dest: 孤儿岩，恐怕是个很危险的活儿。我们未必能活着回来。

String.Source: Although make sure you never try to lift one. My back still hasn't recovered from that one time.
String.Dest: 但是永远不要试着那样做。自从上次跟个胖妞儿睡觉后，我的后背还没恢复呐。

String.Source: Orphan Rock. It'll likely be a perilous undertaking. We may not survive.
String.Dest: 孤儿岩，恐怕是个很危险的活儿。我们未必能活着回来。

String.Source: Anyways, I guess it doesn't matter where we're going, since you're leading the way. Just be sure to take plenty of breaks.
String.Dest: 不管怎么说，我猜无论我们去哪，只要你领路就无所谓。只是保证旅途有充足的休息就好。

String.Source: It's probably nothing, but we're going to Falkreath. So pack your things.
String.Dest: 也许这不代表什么，但我们得去佛克瑞斯一趟。收拾好你的东西。

String.Source: If it's dead people you're looking for, that would be the place. I wonder if Narri is still working at the inn.
String.Dest: If it's dead people you're looking for, that would be the place. I wonder if Narri is still working at the inn.

String.Source: It's probably nothing, but we're going to Falkreath. So pack your things.
String.Dest: 也许这不代表什么，但我们得去佛克瑞斯一趟。收拾好你的东西。

String.Source: She was always comments on how handsome I am. The girl can't help herself.
String.Dest: 她总是沉溺于称赞我是多么的英俊神武。这个傻女孩已经坠入爱河无法自拔了。

String.Source: It's probably nothing, but we're going to Falkreath. So pack your things.
String.Dest: 也许这不代表什么，但我们得去佛克瑞斯一趟。收拾好你的东西。

String.Source: Anyways, I guess it doesn't matter where we're going, since you're leading the way. Just be sure to take plenty of breaks.
String.Dest: 不管怎么说，我猜无论我们去哪，只要你领路就无所谓。只是保证旅途有充足的休息就好。

String.Source: If only you can kill them, what do you need the rest of us for?
String.Dest: 如果只有你能杀了他们，那你还要我们做什么？

String.Source: Good question. Usually it's because there's a lot of other things that need killing to. Things that are beneath me.
String.Dest: 问得好。因为总是有好多事儿需要用杀戮解决。一些见不得光的事儿。

String.Source: If only you can kill them, what do you need the rest of us for?
String.Dest: 如果只有你能杀了他们，那你还要我们做什么？

String.Source: Anyways, I guess it doesn't matter where we're going, since you're leading the way. Just be sure to take plenty of breaks.
String.Dest: 不管怎么说，我猜无论我们去哪，只要你领路就无所谓。只是保证旅途有充足的休息就好。

String.Source: Thane Larsdon believes we might find it at Orphan Rock.
String.Dest: 劳斯登男爵相信我们可以找到孤儿岩。

String.Source: Orphan Rock? I doubt we'll find anything but a coven of witches, and when I'm through with them, a trail of broken hearts.
String.Dest: 孤儿岩？除了一个女巫大聚会，我们恐怕找不到什么东西了，我那时可会一路突破一路心碎的啊。

String.Source: Thane Larsdon believes we might find it at Orphan Rock.
String.Dest: 劳斯登男爵相信我们可以找到孤儿岩。

String.Source: Anyways, I guess it doesn't matter where we're going, since you're leading the way. Just be sure to take plenty of breaks.
String.Dest: 不管怎么说，我猜无论我们去哪，只要你领路就无所谓。只是保证旅途有充足的休息就好。

String.Source: Anyways, we're finished here. Doesn't look like there's anything that's better than what we already have.
String.Dest: 反正现在，我们的事儿都搞定了。看不出还有什么可以搞得更好的。

String.Source: So do we know where we're headed next? Supposedly there's some barrow somewhere full of things that only I can kill.
String.Dest: 所以说你想好我们接下来要去哪儿了吗？很可能在某地的某些古坟里呆着的玩意儿只有我才能解决得掉。

String.Source: Wisps, skeletons, and headstones. I think I need to raise my rates.
String.Dest: 幽魂，骨头架子，还有墓碑。我想我得跑快点儿。

String.Source: You just have to appreciate the part of the inn that has me in it.
String.Dest: 你只需要欣赏旅馆里我待的那块地方就行啦。

String.Source: Not every adventure happens in some moldy old cave.
String.Dest: 不是所有的冒险都发生在一些发霉的破山洞里。

String.Source: What about you Elf? Where are you headed next?
String.Dest: 那你呢，精灵？接下来去哪？

String.Source: I don't think so. This was fun, but I feel a nice warm fire calling me back at the Four Shields.
String.Dest: 我不这么认为，这很有趣，但我感觉有团温暖的篝火呼唤着我回四面盾酒馆。

String.Source: Not to mention Julienne Lylvieve. The poor girl is probably a wreck given how long it's been since she's last seen my face.
String.Dest: 更不用说朱利安尼·李维弗斯了。鉴于她已经很久没有看见我的脸了，那个可怜的姑娘可能已经崩溃了。

String.Source: If the Dragonborn gets your bow, what do I get, aside from your undying love and admiration.
String.Dest: 如果龙裔拿到了你的弓，那我又得到了什么？除了你的永恒的爱和赞赏。

String.Source: Probably just the wind.
String.Dest: 可能是风。

String.Source: And where is this axe going to be? Don't tell me we're going to have to dig up coffins.
String.Dest: 那这把斧子去哪儿了呢？别告诉我我们必须去挖开棺材！

String.Source: I've got an idea. Why don't we wait for them to retrieve the axe for us, and then just take it from whoever comes running out of the cave?
String.Dest: 我有个主意，为什么我们不等着他们给我们把斧子取回来？那时候我们只需要从跑出洞穴的家伙手里取回来就是了。

String.Source: Friends of yours?
String.Dest: 你朋友吗？

String.Source: Sounds like you don't trust him.
String.Dest: 听起来你不信任他.

String.Source: Stop it. Don't even joke about my death. It would be like the Red Mountain erupting during the reign of the Mad King. A total nightmare.
String.Dest: 阻止它。别拿我的死来开玩笑。这疯子国王的统治就像是红山爆发一般。一场噩梦。

String.Source: It's not about numbers, Elf, although I assure you, they're mind blowing. It's really about quality and variety. That's my true claim to fame.
String.Dest: 精灵啊，这可不是人数多少的问题，不过我向你保证，她们都爽翻天了。真正重要的是种类齐全质量上乘，那才是我所自豪的啊。

String.Source: I've bedded wenches and nobles, farmers' daughters and soldiers' wives.
String.Dest: 不论是女侍还是贵族，农夫的闺女还是士兵的妻子，我都睡过。

String.Source: This would be so much easier if Helgen wasn't burned to the ground.
String.Dest: 如果海尔根没有被烧毁的话，这应该不难。

String.Source: You know, I didn't really mind the dragons all that much until they started inconveniencing me.
String.Dest: 你知道的，在那些该死的大蜥蜴开始给我添麻烦之前，我还真不是怎么太过在意龙的。

String.Source: You two are married? Yeack.
String.Dest: 你们两个结婚啦？哇哦。

String.Source: You two know each other? Small world. But seeing as I'm at the center of it, it's natural for all of you to gravitate toward me.
String.Dest: 你们俩认识？世界可真小。但介于我都认识你们，这就说明你们两个人都是被我的魅力所吸引了。

String.Source: Yeah, except you have to be a mage to wield one. What do you think of this mace? Seems fairly balanced.
String.Dest: 是啊，除非你必须做为一名法师来用它。你觉得这锤子怎么样？看起来很平衡的样子。

String.Source: Well, in my case it would be my face. Which is precisely why I don't like helmets. But I see what you're getting at. No hands, no music.
String.Dest: 呃，于我而言，这就是我的脸。这正是为什么我不喜欢头盔。但我明白你是什么意思。没有双手，就演奏不了音乐。

String.Source: Argh...my back is killing me. I could do with a hot bath, a massage, and maybe a chef to bake me a sweet roll.
String.Dest: 啊…我的后背痛死了。我得洗个热水澡，按摩一下，也许再让厨师给我烤个甜甜圈。

String.Source: He's become a Bard at the College.
String.Dest: 他成为了学院的一名诗人。

String.Source: Of course he is. I knew the day I became a bard that the little imp would follow. Figures he would opt for the college route.
String.Dest: 他当然会。我知道如果某一天我成了一名吟游诗人，这个小鬼头也会效仿。估计他会选择去学院学习的。

String.Source: He's become a Bard at the College.
String.Dest: 他成为了学院的一名诗人。

String.Source: Just ignore the fool and pretend we never had this conversation.
String.Dest: 别管那个白痴还有就当我们没说过这些。

String.Source: True, but I'm not just any writer. On the other hand, I suppose if I was always producing priceless works, the world itself would stop.
String.Dest: True, but I'm not just any writer. On the other hand, I suppose if I was always producing priceless works, the world itself would stop.

String.Source: Don't worry. A lot of writers go through this.
String.Dest: Don't worry. A lot of writers go through this.

String.Source: No one would have time for anything else, save listening to my voice. So I guess you're right, I shouldn't worry. Thanks.
String.Dest: No one would have time for anything else, save listening to my voice. So I guess you're right, I shouldn't worry. Thanks.

String.Source: Don't worry. A lot of writers go through this.
String.Dest: Don't worry. A lot of writers go through this.

String.Source: Why? Every man's got doubts. But it passes. It's just taking a little longer this time.
String.Dest: Why? Every man's got doubts. But it passes. It's just taking a little longer this time.

String.Source: That's surprising. I've never seen you apprehensive about anything.
String.Dest: That's surprising. I've never seen you apprehensive about anything.

String.Source: Ah, forget it, let's just keep moving.
String.Dest: Ah, forget it, let's just keep moving.

String.Source: That's surprising. I've never seen you apprehensive about anything.
String.Dest: That's surprising. I've never seen you apprehensive about anything.

String.Source: This isn't the time for barbs. Sure, I'm still a great warrior and devilishly handsome, but that can only go so far.
String.Dest: This isn't the time for barbs. Sure, I'm still a great warrior and devilishly handsome, but that can only go so far.

String.Source: You can't lose what you never had.
String.Dest: You can't lose what you never had.

String.Source: Ah, it'll pass like it always does. Forget what I said, I was just thinking out loud.
String.Dest: Ah, it'll pass like it always does. Forget what I said, I was just thinking out loud.

String.Source: You can't lose what you never had.
String.Dest: You can't lose what you never had.

String.Source: Gods, that's depressing. Oh well, at least I'll always have my looks.
String.Dest: Gods, that's depressing. Oh well, at least I'll always have my looks.

String.Source: It's not. All things fade over time.
String.Dest: It's not. All things fade over time.

String.Source: You look like you want to get something off your chest.
String.Dest: 你好像很想把心里的烦恼说出来。

String.Source: I would like to recite a poem. To be frank, one I just weaved into creation. This is an ode to the common wooden bench.
String.Dest: 我比较喜欢背诵诗歌。坦率地说，我唯一原创的东西，是一首对平凡木椅的颂歌。

String.Source: You look like you want to get something off your chest.
String.Dest: 你好像很想把心里的烦恼说出来。

String.Source: The bench, who stands firm while glazed in the sun's golden honey, the bench who never breaks, while its skin is wrinkled by the gray.
String.Dest: 长椅，永远站在太阳金色的光辉中。长椅，永远不会倒下，即便它的皮肤都变成灰色，充满褶皱。

String.Source: You look like you want to get something off your chest.
String.Dest: 你好像很想把心里的烦恼说出来。

String.Source: That old wooden bench, the place where fatigue met its bane, that old wooden slab, where the breeze found a home.
String.Dest: 那老旧的木长椅啊，疲劳遇到克星的地方，那老旧的长木板啊，微风找到归属的地方。

String.Source: You look like you want to get something off your chest.
String.Dest: 你好像很想把心里的烦恼说出来。

String.Source: That long slender pine, who welcomes high and low, that old steady partner, a traveler's best friend.
String.Dest: 那又细又长的松树，高高低低的夹道欢迎着，是古老坚定的伙伴，是旅行者最好的朋友。

String.Source: You look like you want to get something off your chest.
String.Dest: 你好像很想把心里的烦恼说出来。

String.Source: The common wooden bench, whose very essence is Sundas morning, the common wooden bench, often misunderstood, but never misused.
String.Dest: 那寻常的木凳啊，周日的清晨是它的本质；那寻常的木凳啊，经常被误解却从未曾迷惑。

String.Source: You look like you want to get something off your chest.
String.Dest: 你好像很想把心里的烦恼说出来。

String.Source: No, not since my last masterpiece. To be honest, it's starting to worry me. What if genius isn't permanent?
String.Dest: No, not since my last masterpiece. To be honest, it's starting to worry me. What if genius isn't permanent?

String.Source: Have you written any new poetry or music since we've been on the road?
String.Dest: Have you written any new poetry or music since we've been on the road?

String.Source: You two idiots deserve each other.
String.Dest: 你们两个白痴活该！

String.Source: The only thing that imp deserves is a long, scalding bath in the Skyforge. I, on the other hand, will settle for a tub of ale.
String.Dest: 小矮子就该被扔进天空熔炉里好好洗涮洗涮。我呢，我要杯麦芽酒就行了。

String.Source: You two idiots deserve each other.
String.Dest: 你们两个白痴活该！

String.Source: But I don't think those bards will appreciate me killing one of their own, even if he's as ugly as plants are green.
String.Dest: 但我不认为吟游诗人会感激我杀死他们中的一员，哪怕那人就像绿色植物一样的丑陋。

String.Source: You two idiots deserve each other.
String.Dest: 你们两个白痴活该！

String.Source: I'll leave it up to you. The little imp means nothing to me, but if you think I should kill him, I'd be more than happy to do the honor.
String.Dest: 我会把他留给你。这小鬼对我毫无意义，但是如果你认为我应该杀了他，我乐意效劳。

String.Source: What kind of duels have you and the Breton had?
String.Dest: 你和那个布莱顿人曾经做出了什么样的决斗？

String.Source: We've fought with swords, bare knuckles, knives, bows, and scrolls.
String.Dest: We've fought with swords, bare knuckles, knives, bows, and scrolls.

String.Source: What kind of duels have you and the Breton had?
String.Dest: 你和那个布莱顿人曾经做出了什么样的决斗？

String.Source: We've fought in the snow, in caves, in taverns and on horseback. We've fought alone, with companions, or on opposite sides of the war.
String.Dest: We've fought in the snow, in caves, in taverns and on horseback. We've fought alone, with companions, or on opposite sides of the war.

String.Source: What kind of duels have you and the Breton had?
String.Dest: 你和那个布莱顿人曾经做出了什么样的决斗？

String.Source: The one place he doesn't like to fight is out in the sun. I think it's because he's a bloody vampire.
String.Dest: 他不喜欢在阳光下作战。我想这是因为他是个嗜血的吸血鬼。

String.Source: What kind of duels have you and the Breton had?
String.Dest: 你和那个布莱顿人曾经做出了什么样的决斗？

String.Source: Now that I'm a bard, he'll likely become a writer, so he can document his lies in books while I immortalize the truth in song.
String.Dest: 现在我是一个游吟诗人，他很可能成为一名作家，所以他可以把他的谎言记录在书里，而我就可以把真相用歌传咏下去。

String.Source: Can you tell me about these duels?
String.Dest: 你怎么看待这场决斗呢？

String.Source: I remember bits and pieces, a few stories here and there, but I hardly keep a ledger.
String.Dest: 我记得一些零碎的片断，一个这样那样的故事，但我却很难记住分类账。

String.Source: Can you tell me about these duels?
String.Dest: 你怎么看待这场决斗呢？

String.Source: If you want the details, you will have to ask him. I can't be expected to recall events that are so unworthy of my memories.
String.Dest: 如果你想知道详细内容，你要去问他。不要指望我回想起那么卑劣的记忆。

String.Source: This feud is silly. Just talk to the man and make peace.
String.Dest: 这种争论真无聊。只要跟那个人说一声就能摆平。

String.Source: Are you out of your mind? This man is my sworn enemy. Dogs and cats will be holding hands in the street before I make peace with the Breton.
String.Dest: 你疯了吗？这是我不共戴天的死敌。除非大街上的猫和狗能友好的爪牵爪，否则别指望我和这个布莱顿人和睦相处。

String.Source: This feud is silly. Just talk to the man and make peace.
String.Dest: 这种争论真无聊。只要跟那个人说一声就能摆平。

String.Source: But the imp is too insignificant for me to bother with him. So while I won't make peace, I don't have to make war either.
String.Dest: 但要在那混小子身上费心实在太不值得了，所以我既不想和解，也不想挑起纷争。

String.Source: This feud is silly. Just talk to the man and make peace.
String.Dest: 这种争论真无聊。只要跟那个人说一声就能摆平。

String.Source: Ultimately, it's your decision. You give the order, I'll spray the blood.
String.Dest: 基本上，这是你的决定。你发布施令，我会为你赴汤蹈火。

String.Source: An original song, please.
String.Dest: 来首老歌,谢谢。

String.Source: Yes, it's natural for you to assume that I compose as well as I sing. And as a matter of fact, I do, but not for free.
String.Dest: 是的，你认为我不但唱歌而且作曲是很正常的。而事实上，我确实会写曲子，但不是免费的。

String.Source: Ragnar the Red.
String.Dest: 红衣拉格纳。

String.Source: Ah, a fine and bloody tale, and a good request.
String.Dest: 啊，一个惨不忍闻的好故事，还有一个不错的请求。

String.Source: He was no shorter than any other Breton. And he was pale, not green.
String.Dest: 他在布莱顿人里面不比哪一个矮，而且他皮肤是白的，一点都不绿。

String.Source: Must not have been the same guy then. This one you wouldn't forget.
String.Dest: 你一定不能步那种家伙的后尘，这一点你不能忘记。

String.Source: He was no shorter than any other Breton. And he was pale, not green.
String.Dest: 他在布莱顿人里面不比哪一个矮，而且他皮肤是白的，一点都不绿。

String.Source: If ugliness were a crime, all the gold in Tamriel couldn't clear his bounty. Best to ignore the fool and pretend we never had this conversation.
String.Dest: 如果丑陋是一种罪，那整个泰姆瑞尔大陆的金钱都无法洗脱他的罪名，你最好忘了那个白痴并装作我们从来没有谈论过这事。

String.Source: But I take it you didn't actually fight blindfolded.
String.Dest: 虽然我把它眼睛蒙住了.你竟然没打

String.Source: We settled on mounted combat, which I accepted knowing he had already bribed Skulvar into giving him the superior horse.
String.Dest: 我们决定马战，在得知他已经给自己的顶级战马喂了斯库玛的情况下我还是接受了。

String.Source: But I take it you didn't actually fight blindfolded.
String.Dest: 虽然我把它眼睛蒙住了.你竟然没打

String.Source: The rain continued to pour that night, our horses trundling through the mud. It was his opinion that the vast tundra would make for a fine arena.
String.Dest: 那夜的雨一直下个不停，我们的马缓缓地踏过泥泞。他觉得广阔的苔原能成为一个极佳的竞技场。

String.Source: But I take it you didn't actually fight blindfolded.
String.Dest: 虽然我把它眼睛蒙住了.你竟然没打

String.Source: I could barely see through the blades of water that whipped into our eyes, as he positioned his steed 100 horse lengths from mine.
String.Dest: 很难看清楚啊，叶片溅起的水都溅进我眼睛里去了。而且他的马和我的马之间足够容得下100匹马。

String.Source: But I take it you didn't actually fight blindfolded.
String.Dest: 虽然我把它眼睛蒙住了.你竟然没打

String.Source: We were to charge at the sound of his companion's horn, and when it blared, I flew.
String.Dest: We were to charge at the sound of his companion's horn, and when it blared, I flew.

String.Source: Naturally.
String.Dest: 自然地。

String.Source: We settled on mounted combat, which I accepted knowing he had already bribed Skulvar into giving him the superior horse.
String.Dest: 我们决定马战，在得知他已经给自己的顶级战马喂了斯库玛的情况下我还是接受了。

String.Source: Naturally.
String.Dest: 自然地。

String.Source: The rain continued to pour that night, our horses trundling through the mud. It was his opinion that the vast tundra would make for a fine arena.
String.Dest: 那夜的雨一直下个不停，我们的马缓缓地踏过泥泞。他觉得广阔的苔原能成为一个极佳的竞技场。

String.Source: Naturally.
String.Dest: 自然地。

String.Source: I could barely see through the blades of water that whipped into our eyes, as he positioned his steed 100 horse lengths from mine.
String.Dest: 很难看清楚啊，叶片溅起的水都溅进我眼睛里去了。而且他的马和我的马之间足够容得下100匹马。

String.Source: Naturally.
String.Dest: 自然地。

String.Source: We were to charge at the sound of his companion's horn, and when it blared, I flew.
String.Dest: We were to charge at the sound of his companion's horn, and when it blared, I flew.

String.Source: Surely the mounted duel must have been memorable.
String.Dest: 当然，在马背上的战斗肯定是令人难忘的。

String.Source: If you're that interested in my exploits, I'm sure I can drudge up a few details.
String.Dest: 如果你对我的工作这么感兴趣，我相信我能深入研究几个细节部分。

String.Source: Surely the mounted duel must have been memorable.
String.Dest: 当然，在马背上的战斗肯定是令人难忘的。

String.Source: Let's see...I believe it was a stormy night in Whiterun, and travelers from across the Hold crammed themselves into The Bannered Mare.
String.Dest: 让我们看看……我想在雪漫夜晚雷雨交加的时候，来自各个领地的旅人都会挤去母马横幅。

String.Source: Surely the mounted duel must have been memorable.
String.Dest: 当然，在马背上的战斗肯定是令人难忘的。

String.Source: I remember being confronted by a child dressed head to toe in steel, only upon removing his helmet he revealed himself as the Breton.
String.Dest: 我记得我对面的那个孩子从都到脚都被包在盔甲里，只有在他摘掉头盔头盔之后露出来的那张脸暴露出他是一个布莱顿人。

String.Source: Surely the mounted duel must have been memorable.
String.Dest: 当然，在马背上的战斗肯定是令人难忘的。

String.Source: In the interest of sport, I offered to allow him to duel me on horseback, while I fought blindfolded. It was the only way to even the odds.
String.Dest: 出于戏弄的目的，我同意蒙着眼睛与他在马背上决斗。这是成功的唯一方法了。

String.Source: I wasn't aware servant's had such an oath.
String.Dest: 我不知道仆人有这样的誓言。

String.Source: Indeed. Only I can think of nothing more dreadful than going unnoticed. You see, I've always longed for attention. Yearned for it. Craved it.
String.Dest: Indeed. Only I can think of nothing more dreadful than going unnoticed. You see, I've always longed for attention. Yearned for it. Craved it.

String.Source: I wasn't aware servant's had such an oath.
String.Dest: 我不知道仆人有这样的誓言。

String.Source: And there is no purer attention, no higher appraisal of one's worth than the giving of applause.
String.Dest: 而且这里没有比纯粹的关注，以及给予热烈的掌声更高能的肯定某人价值的方式了。

String.Source: I wasn't aware servant's had such an oath.
String.Dest: 我不知道仆人有这样的誓言。

String.Source: That's what I play for. The last pluck of a lute string, and that faint echo of silence before the crowd roars in appreciation.
String.Dest: 这就是我为什么而演奏。最后轻撩一下鲁特琴弦，在微弱的琴声归于沉寂之前，人群会发出赞颂和欢呼。

String.Source: I wasn't aware servant's had such an oath.
String.Dest: 我不知道仆人有这样的誓言。

String.Source: I play for both the silence and the roar, the anticipation and the climax. The moments that seem to go on forever, and yet are never long enough.
String.Dest: 为了沉默与高歌，期望与精彩。曾认为是永冬的坚冰，现已经如春初之融雪。

String.Source: A noble creed.
String.Dest: 一个高贵的信念。

String.Source: Indeed. Only I can think of nothing more dreadful than going unnoticed. You see, I've always longed for attention. Yearned for it. Craved it.
String.Dest: Indeed. Only I can think of nothing more dreadful than going unnoticed. You see, I've always longed for attention. Yearned for it. Craved it.

String.Source: A noble creed.
String.Dest: 一个高贵的信念。

String.Source: And there is no purer attention, no higher appraisal of one's worth than the giving of applause.
String.Dest: 而且这里没有比纯粹的关注，以及给予热烈的掌声更高能的肯定某人价值的方式了。

String.Source: A noble creed.
String.Dest: 一个高贵的信念。

String.Source: That's what I play for. The last pluck of a lute string, and that faint echo of silence before the crowd roars in appreciation.
String.Dest: 这就是我为什么而演奏。最后轻撩一下鲁特琴弦，在微弱的琴声归于沉寂之前，人群会发出赞颂和欢呼。

String.Source: A noble creed.
String.Dest: 一个高贵的信念。

String.Source: I play for both the silence and the roar, the anticipation and the climax. The moments that seem to go on forever, and yet are never long enough.
String.Dest: 为了沉默与高歌，期望与精彩。曾认为是永冬的坚冰，现已经如春初之融雪。

String.Source: What sort of pedigree do you come from?
String.Dest: 你出自于哪一个家系？

String.Source: The humblest of births, but someday, the most glorious of ends. That is, if someone like myself is even capable of dying. I'm not entirely sure.
String.Dest: 最卑微的出身，但总有一天，可以成就最辉煌的结局。更确切地说，如果有人喜欢我，甚至能为我而死的话。但我不确定会不会有这么一天。

String.Source: What sort of pedigree do you come from?
String.Dest: 你出自于哪一个家系？

String.Source: Yet I am indeed a far cry from the life my mother sought to raise me in, when she was but a handmaiden working in Dragonsreach.
String.Dest: 到现在为止我确实离我妈想要培养我而成的人生相去甚远，那时她才不过是一个在龙临堡里打杂的侍女呢。

String.Source: What sort of pedigree do you come from?
String.Dest: 你出自于哪一个家系？

String.Source: In my childhood I grew up around nobles, Thanes, and highborn lords, sworn to the servant's oath, "To perform one's duty, and to go unnoticed."
String.Dest: 在我的童年时代，我在贵族，勇士，和高贵的领主身边成长。我向仆人的誓约起誓,"履行自己的义务，尽量不被注意。"

String.Source: The Tale of the Tongues.
String.Dest: 龙语传说。

String.Source: An excellent request.
String.Dest: 不错的请求。

String.Source: Did you ever find out what happened to him?
String.Dest: 你查出他到底发生什么事了吗？

String.Source: We found him lying in the mud, his horse having slipped and broken both their legs. He blamed me, of course, for sabotaging his horse.
String.Dest: 我们发现他倒在泥里，他的马滑到了，把他的两条腿都压断了。结果他却怪上了我，当然，因为我把他的马给整坏了。

String.Source: Did you ever find out what happened to him?
String.Dest: 你查出他到底发生什么事了吗？

String.Source: What does he think, I used some sort of mind control on the beast? I wouldn't put it past me, but it's not a power I possess.
String.Dest: 他想什么呢？以为我对那只野兽用了意念控制什么的？我倒是有这个想法，不过确实没这本事啊。

String.Source: Did you ever find out what happened to him?
String.Dest: 你查出他到底发生什么事了吗？

String.Source: I am inclined to believe it was his companion that brought him a lame horse, in order to salvage the little imp's life.
String.Dest: 我更愿意相信他是她的伙伴，他带来了一匹瘸了腿的马，为了救这小鬼的性命。

String.Source: What ultimately happened?
String.Dest: 最后发生了什么？

String.Source: I flew through the storm like a mighty chariot, passels of water flinging about in my wake.
String.Dest: 我如战车般在暴雨中飞过，雨水抛撒在我身后。

String.Source: What ultimately happened?
String.Dest: 最后发生了什么？

String.Source: I felt the elements swirling around me, focusing their energy into my axe. I knew then the Breton would die that day.
String.Dest: 我感觉到了那围绕在我身边的元素，它们将能量注入我的战斧。我的直觉告诉我，这个布莱顿这回死定了。

String.Source: What ultimately happened?
String.Dest: 最后发生了什么？

String.Source: Only the little imp was nowhere to be found. I assumed he had fled. That would've been the sensible thing.
String.Dest: 只有那个小鬼哪里都找不到。我估计他是逃走了，这是明智的选择。

String.Source: I take it you're a bard.
String.Dest: 我知道你是个诗人。

String.Source: That's right, although I wasn't always a handsome bard. I used to be a handsome adventurer, and before that I was just handsome.
String.Dest: 是啊，虽然我不一直都是一位英俊的吟游诗人的。我曾经是个英俊的冒险家，而在那之前我只是个英俊的普通人。

String.Source: I take it you're a bard.
String.Dest: 我知道你是个诗人。

String.Source: Unfortunately, my adventuring days came to an end after I nearly lost my life in a scuffle with a group of bandits known as the Silver Hand.
String.Dest: 不幸的是，我在与一群被称为银手的强盗发生了一场混战之后，险些丢掉了小命。我的冒险生涯也因此结束了。

String.Source: I take it you're a bard.
String.Dest: 我知道你是个诗人。

String.Source: After that, I figured it wasn't worth it. Sure, I was a damn good fighter, the best, but I was damn near good at everything else too.
String.Dest: 在那之后，我发现那并不值得。没错，作为战士来说我实在太特么厉害了，我是最厉害的那个，不仅如此，就算是在别的领域，我也特么的堪称完美。

String.Source: I take it you're a bard.
String.Dest: 我知道你是个诗人。

String.Source: I owed it to this world to keep me alive. I can't even begin to imagine what sort of daedric nightmare Skyrim would be if I didn't exist.
String.Dest: 这是我欠这个养育我的世界的债。无法想象没有我存在的话天际会变成怎样的一场魔族噩梦。

String.Source: What makes your voice so special?
String.Dest: 什么让你的嗓音如此特别？

String.Source: Some think it was a voice born to tell stories, or one meant to lead men into battle. Others contend my very throat was forged by dragon fire.
String.Dest: 一些人认为，这声音是为讲故事而生的，或是旨在引领人们投入战斗。而其他人则认为我的喉咙被巨龙之焰重塑过。

String.Source: What makes your voice so special?
String.Dest: 什么让你的嗓音如此特别？

String.Source: I've heard some describe it like a bottle of hard whiskey and boiled potatoes, like smoke misting off hot coals.
String.Dest: 我听别人说它就像是一瓶烈性的威士忌还有煮土豆，就像是冒着青烟的热碳。

String.Source: What makes your voice so special?
String.Dest: 什么让你的嗓音如此特别？

String.Source: Most tell me it's a voice that carries with it a sense of authority. A voice fit for king. I do nothing to dissuade such accusations.
String.Dest: 大多数人告诉我这声音带着一股权威的意味。说这是属于帝王的声音。我没办法阻止这样的罪名。

String.Source: What makes your voice so special?
String.Dest: 什么让你的嗓音如此特别？

String.Source: Now imagine this regal, manly voice of mine singing all the bard's favorites. Why, patrons from here to Riften will come to this inn to hear it.
String.Dest: 现在想象一下这种伟岸的感觉吧，我的声音将会成为所有吟游诗人的最爱！至于为什么嘛，从这里到裂谷的恩主们都会到这间酒店来听我唱歌。

String.Source: What makes your voice so special?
String.Dest: 什么让你的嗓音如此特别？

String.Source: Yet despite me doubling her business, Faida insists on charging me for a room. Such greed is unbecoming.
String.Dest: 尽管我加倍资助了她的生意，法伊达仍然坚持要我的房子。多么不可思议的贪婪。

String.Source: What do you mean by "A beast?"
String.Dest: 你说的“一只野兽”是指……？

String.Source: To be specific, she said I was a werewolf. When rumor spread around of my "transformation," I became a target of the Silver Hand.
String.Dest: 具体说来，她说我是个狼人。当关于我的“变化”的谣言四散之时，我成为了银手的目标。

String.Source: What do you mean by "A beast?"
String.Dest: 你说的“一只野兽”是指……？

String.Source: That wench made the coffin maker a lot of money that day, with all the men I was now forced to kill. I'm beginning to think the two were kin.
String.Dest: 那女侍在那一天让棺材制造商赚了很多钱，用来承装所有我不得不杀死的家伙。我开始觉得那两个人是亲属了。

String.Source: I'm in love with Amalee. You want her, you'll have to get in line.
String.Dest: 我和艾米莉正在热恋中。你想要她请排队。

String.Source: Don't worry, I have no intention of stealing the girl's heart. But when I conquer this imp, don't be mad if she hands it over to me.
String.Dest: 别担心，我没打算偷走那女孩的心。可当我征服这个小淘气之后，她主动送上来给我你可别生气。

String.Source: I'm in love with Amalee. You want her, you'll have to get in line.
String.Dest: 我和艾米莉正在热恋中。你想要她请排队。

String.Source: The alternative is I don't duel the imp. Of course, the more you try to separate her from my magnificence, the more she will resent you for it.
String.Dest: The alternative is I don't duel the imp. Of course, the more you try to separate her from my magnificence, the more she will resent you for it.

String.Source: I'm in love with Amalee. You want her, you'll have to get in line.
String.Dest: 我和艾米莉正在热恋中。你想要她请排队。

String.Source: So why not bring me to this duel and take your chances? Who knows, maybe you'll get lucky and a dragon will eat the little imp before we get there.
String.Dest: 那为什么不带上我去碰碰运气呢？谁知道呢，也许你够走运，能在龙吃掉那个小鬼头之前赶到。

String.Source: Neither you nor the Breton are any good. This is just to humor my friend.
String.Dest: 你和那个布莱顿都不怎么样。这只是个俏皮话我的朋友。

String.Source: Denial is such a sad, sad, attribute. As is jealousy. I find both to be the reasons why people are critical of me.
String.Dest: 拒绝是一个如此让人感到悲伤，难过的属性。如同嫉妒一样。我想我也找到了人们挑剔我的原因。

String.Source: Neither you nor the Breton are any good. This is just to humor my friend.
String.Dest: 你和那个布莱顿都不怎么样。这只是个俏皮话我的朋友。

String.Source: The women are sickened with themselves for falling so hopelessly in love. The men are jealous for losing their women to a man they've never even met.
String.Dest: 姑娘们会因为如此无药可解的陷入爱河而厌恶自己，男人会嫉妒他们前任的另一半，即使他们素未谋面。

String.Source: Neither you nor the Breton are any good. This is just to humor my friend.
String.Dest: 你和那个布莱顿都不怎么样。这只是个俏皮话我的朋友。

String.Source: So if I'm going to duel the imp, I suggest you refrain from insulting me. You're only going to look foolish in the end.
String.Dest: So if I'm going to duel the imp, I suggest you refrain from insulting me. You're only going to look foolish in the end.

String.Source: Maybe if you were a tree. Amalee doesn't seem to care for mortal beauty.
String.Dest: 或许你真的是一棵树。艾米莉似乎并不苛求道德上的完美。

String.Source: You're making the mistake of comparing me to other mortals. It doesn't matter who or what she fancied before: women, trees, Argonians...
String.Dest: 你把我跟那些凡人们作比较就是个错误。她在之前如何幻想或者在幻想什么根本就不重要：女人，树木，还有那些亚龙人……

String.Source: Maybe if you were a tree. Amalee doesn't seem to care for mortal beauty.
String.Dest: 或许你真的是一棵树。艾米莉似乎并不苛求道德上的完美。

String.Source: Those feelings were but castles in the sand, toppled over by a crushing tidal wave of handsomeness.
String.Dest: 那些感觉只是沙子堆成的城堡，在被英俊的外表冲刷过后便会倾塌。

String.Source: Maybe if you were a tree. Amalee doesn't seem to care for mortal beauty.
String.Dest: 或许你真的是一棵树。艾米莉似乎并不苛求道德上的完美。

String.Source: It almost seems cruel to assault her with a second wave of my greatness, but if the imp wants to stand in my way, then so be it. Take me to him.
String.Dest: 我第二波用自己的伟大来打击她大概有些残忍。不过要是那个小淘气想要碍我的事，那就没办法啦。带我去见他。

String.Source: Amalee isn't really his squire. But win this duel, and she could be yours.
String.Dest: 艾米莉其实不是他的侍从. 不过只要赢了这场决斗,她就是你的了.

String.Source: I'm not one for squires or bestowing titles of any kind. If the girl wants to follow me, she can.
String.Dest: 我不想要侍从，也不想被授予任何形式的头衔。但如果这姑娘想跟着我，随她便。

String.Source: Amalee isn't really his squire. But win this duel, and she could be yours.
String.Dest: 艾米莉其实不是他的侍从. 不过只要赢了这场决斗,她就是你的了.

String.Source: But you can bet I'll teach her a lot of things, mostly of a carnal nature, and who knows, maybe some of it might be useful to an aspiring bard.
String.Dest: 但是你可以打赌，我会教她很多东西，最主要的是肉体的天性，谁知道呢，也许对一名有抱负的吟游诗人来说，其中的一部分会十分有用。

String.Source: Amalee isn't really his squire. But win this duel, and she could be yours.
String.Dest: 艾米莉其实不是他的侍从. 不过只要赢了这场决斗,她就是你的了.

String.Source: Anyhow, if the girl is the prize, then it seems the little imp has finally devised a duel worth having. Count me in.
String.Dest: 无论如何，如果这个女孩是战利品，那么看起来这个小淘气最后要预谋一场有意义的斗争。加我一个。

String.Source: As a soldier of Dibella, it's possible Amalee prefers women.
String.Dest: 作为迪贝拉的守卫，艾米莉很可能喜欢女人。

String.Source: Up until 10 seconds ago, I'd say you were right. Then I made eye contact, and changed every opinion she ever had on men.
String.Dest: 就在至多十秒之前我会说你是对的。然后我和她目光相接，随即改观了她之前对男人的所有看法。

String.Source: As a soldier of Dibella, it's possible Amalee prefers women.
String.Dest: 作为迪贝拉的守卫，艾米莉很可能喜欢女人。

String.Source: The seeds of worship have been planted, and the harder she pushes me away, the taller this tree will grow.
String.Dest: 崇拜的种子已经种下了，她越远离我，这粒种子所长成的树会越来越高。

String.Source: As a soldier of Dibella, it's possible Amalee prefers women.
String.Dest: 作为迪贝拉的守卫，艾米莉很可能喜欢女人。

String.Source: When I duel the Breton, it will pour rain upon that seed. So yeah, take me to the little imp. I'd very much like to devour this girl's flesh.
String.Dest: 当我跟那个布莱顿人决斗的时候, 仿佛暴风雨蹂躏幼苗一样. 哦，爽，快带我去找我的小可爱，也要让那姑娘爽一把。

String.Source: As a soldier of Dibella, it's possible Amalee prefers women.
String.Dest: 作为迪贝拉的守卫，艾米莉很可能喜欢女人。

String.Source: Up until 10 seconds ago, I'd say you were right. Then I made eye contact, and changed every opinion she ever had on men.
String.Dest: 就在至多十秒之前我会说你是对的。然后我和她目光相接，随即改观了她之前对男人的所有看法。

String.Source: As a soldier of Dibella, it's possible Amalee prefers women.
String.Dest: 作为迪贝拉的守卫，艾米莉很可能喜欢女人。

String.Source: The seeds of worship have been planted, and the harder she pushes me away, the taller this tree will grow.
String.Dest: 崇拜的种子已经种下了，她越远离我，这粒种子所长成的树会越来越高。

String.Source: As a soldier of Dibella, it's possible Amalee prefers women.
String.Dest: 作为迪贝拉的守卫，艾米莉很可能喜欢女人。

String.Source: When I duel the Breton, it will pour rain upon that seed. So yeah, take me to the little imp. I'd very much like to devour this girl's flesh.
String.Dest: 当我跟那个布莱顿人决斗的时候, 仿佛暴风雨蹂躏幼苗一样. 哦，爽，快带我去找我的小可爱，也要让那姑娘爽一把。

String.Source: As a soldier of Dibella, it's possible Amalee prefers women.
String.Dest: 作为迪贝拉的守卫，艾米莉很可能喜欢女人。

String.Source: Almost as much as I'd like to taste yours.
String.Dest: 几乎跟我想尝你的一样多了。

String.Source: Of course, but take this challenge and win, and she will be yours for certain.
String.Dest: 当然！但赢了这个挑战她就是你的人了。

String.Source: I suppose it would be unfair for me not to live up to her expectations. Little does she know that I will undoubtedly surpass them.
String.Dest: 我想如果辜负她的期望对我来说是不公平的。她不知道，我毫无疑问将会超越他们。

String.Source: Of course, but take this challenge and win, and she will be yours for certain.
String.Dest: 当然！但赢了这个挑战她就是你的人了。

String.Source: Very well. Take me to the Breton. I don't even have to prepare. Whatever he wants to duel with, swords, magic, dinnerware, I'll be ready.
String.Dest: 很好。带我去见布莱顿人吧。我甚至都不用准备什么东西，不管他是想跟什么决斗，要用的无非也就剑，法术，餐具这么三样。我会准备好的。

String.Source: Funny, she doesn't look like his usual squire. Has the little imp hired on more minions to tilt the duels in his favor?
String.Dest: 搞笑，她看起来并不像是他平常的侍卫。那小恶魔有没有雇用更多的爪牙来左右决斗的结果？

String.Source: My friend here has come to deliver a challenge from the Breton.
String.Dest: 我这位朋友送来一封来自一个布莱顿人的挑战书。

String.Source: He should be. However, it was a cardinal mistake to send a lady so fetching. No doubt she's already in love with me.
String.Dest: 他应该这样做。但是，派一个如此迷人的女士去是个低级错误。毫无疑问，她已经爱上我了。

String.Source: My friend here has come to deliver a challenge from the Breton.
String.Dest: 我这位朋友送来一封来自一个布莱顿人的挑战书。

String.Source: Just like all the others. Another bloody draw. The imp said his arm was tired from playing the lute all day, so he backed out screamed for the guard.
String.Dest: 就像以前一样，又是一次该死的平局。那小子说他弹了一天鲁特琴胳膊累坏了，于是他逃出去找守卫了。

String.Source: How did your duel with Edwayne end?
String.Dest: 你跟艾德维的决斗谁赢了?

String.Source: He also said his poem was only half finished or something, and that our bard duel wasn't over. At that point, I just tuned him out.
String.Dest: 他还说他的诗只完成了一半什么的，还说我们的诗人间的决斗没有结束。在那时，我只要无视他就好了。

String.Source: How did your duel with Edwayne end?
String.Dest: 你跟艾德维的决斗谁赢了?

String.Source: It happened in an inn not unlike this one, where I met this lovely tavern wench, a bit chubby, but on the voluptuous side of fat.
String.Dest: 发生那件事的酒馆儿跟这个不一样。在那里我邂逅了那个可爱的酒馆女侍，有点胖乎乎的，但就连身上的脂肪也透着性感。

String.Source: What happened with the Silver Hand?
String.Dest: 白银之手怎么了？

String.Source: I could have charmed and cajoled her, but I've always been the type to show rather than tell.
String.Dest: 我可能已经成功用言语吸引住她了，但我并不是能口吐莲花的人。

String.Source: What happened with the Silver Hand?
String.Dest: 白银之手怎么了？

String.Source: So I showed her just exactly how her previously lovers had failed her.
String.Dest: 所以我完完全全的让她目睹了她以前的爱人是如何辜负她的。

String.Source: What happened with the Silver Hand?
String.Dest: 白银之手怎么了？

String.Source: Unfortunately, my fevered thrusts were such that she accused me of turning into a beast during the height of my passion. Literally.
String.Dest: 不幸的是， 我如此亢奋的戳刺，以至于她指责我在兴致高昂的时候变成了一头猛兽。字面上的意思。

String.Source: What happened with the Silver Hand?
String.Dest: 白银之手怎么了？

String.Source: You'll have to ask him. I haven't the faintest idea. Probably fell in love with me or something, seeing as I have that effect on women and men.
String.Dest: 你必须告诉他，我一点儿主意也没有。也许和我或者其他什么坠入爱河，就像是我对某个男人或女人产生了影响。

String.Source: How did this quarrel between you and the Breton begin?
String.Dest: 你和布莱顿人之间的争吵是怎么引发的？

String.Source: All I know is, wherever I go, he manages to show up.
String.Dest: 我只知道，不管我去哪儿，他都会想各种办法冒出来。

String.Source: How did this quarrel between you and the Breton begin?
String.Dest: 你和布莱顿人之间的争吵是怎么引发的？

String.Source: How did this fight start?
String.Dest: 这架是怎么打起来的？

String.Source: Naturally, it was he who initiated both duels. I would never do something so undignified given the circumstances.
String.Dest: 自然，不是他挑起的决斗。我绝不会这种情况下做出如此失礼的行径。

String.Source: How did this fight start?
String.Dest: 这架是怎么打起来的？

String.Source: As the clash of swords tend to echo in those spacious Dwarven ruins, we were limited to bows, and of course I was working with a handicap.
String.Dest: 在那些宽阔的矮人遗迹里，刀剑的碰撞可是会有回声的，所以我们只能用弓，当然那时候我是在跟一个拖油瓶合作。

String.Source: How did this fight start?
String.Dest: 这架是怎么打起来的？

String.Source: After nearly escaping the first duel, the second time the Breton swine came prepared with poison-tipped arrows and 3 red potions tied to his belt.
String.Dest: 在第一对决差点丢掉小命后，第二次布莱顿猪有备而来，裤袋上勒着毒箭和3瓶红药。

String.Source: How did this fight start?
String.Dest: 这架是怎么打起来的？

String.Source: So in effect, to succeed I would have to kill him four times. I only managed three before I ran out of arrows.
String.Dest: 这样的效果是，我要得胜就必须杀死他四次。可我只做到了三次就没箭了。

String.Source: The Hall of the Dead? You should've shown more respect.
String.Dest: 亡者之厅？你应该表现的更尊敬些。

String.Source: It was he who initiated both duels. I would never do something so undignified given the circumstances.
String.Dest: 两次决斗都是他挑起的。在那种场合下我才不会做这种没品的事。

String.Source: The Hall of the Dead? You should've shown more respect.
String.Dest: 亡者之厅？你应该表现的更尊敬些。

String.Source: As the clash of swords tend to echo in those spacious Dwarven ruins, we were limited to bows, and of course I was working with a handicap.
String.Dest: 在那些宽阔的矮人遗迹里，刀剑的碰撞可是会有回声的，所以我们只能用弓，当然那时候我是在跟一个拖油瓶合作。

String.Source: The Hall of the Dead? You should've shown more respect.
String.Dest: 亡者之厅？你应该表现的更尊敬些。

String.Source: After nearly escaping the first duel, the second time the Breton swine came prepared with poison-tipped arrows and 3 red potions tied to his belt.
String.Dest: 在第一对决差点丢掉小命后，第二次布莱顿猪有备而来，裤袋上勒着毒箭和3瓶红药。

String.Source: The Hall of the Dead? You should've shown more respect.
String.Dest: 亡者之厅？你应该表现的更尊敬些。

String.Source: So in effect, to succeed I would have to kill him four times. I only managed three before I ran out of arrows.
String.Dest: 这样的效果是，我要得胜就必须杀死他四次。可我只做到了三次就没箭了。

String.Source: You must at least remember dueling during the war.
String.Dest: 你至少必须要记住在战争期间的决斗。

String.Source: You're right, but only because they happened at the end of the wars we were fighting.
String.Dest: 你说得对，但仅仅是它们发生在我们所参与的战争结束后。

String.Source: You must at least remember dueling during the war.
String.Dest: 你至少必须要记住在战争期间的决斗。

String.Source: We were there when the Jarl of Markarth surrendered to Madanach, and when Madanach surrendered to Ulfric.
String.Dest: 当马卡斯城的领主向迈德纳奇投降，还有迈德纳奇向乌佛瑞克投降的时候，我们就在那儿。

String.Source: You must at least remember dueling during the war.
String.Dest: 你至少必须要记住在战争期间的决斗。

String.Source: We were supposed to be witnesses to the peace accord, but ended up fighting in the Hall of the Dead while the others were in the Keep.
String.Dest: 我们应该是和平协定的见证人，但其他人都在要塞的时候，亡者之厅的战斗已经结束了。

String.Source: The Dragonborn Comes.
String.Dest: 龙裔降临。

String.Source: Very well. That's an old legend, and a song the locals never get tired of.
String.Dest: 很好，这是一个古老的传说，一首当地人永远不会厌倦的歌。

String.Source: How should I know? He told it to me once, shouted it at me really, but I couldn't be bothered to remember such an insignificant detail.
String.Dest: 我怎么知道？他告诉过我，它其实是冲着我喊，但我不想记住这样一个无关紧要的细节。

String.Source: This Breton's name, is it by chance Edwayne?
String.Dest: 这个布莱顿人会不会就是艾德维?

String.Source: You'll likely find him wherever it is filthy skeevers like to congregate, and my name will most assuredly be the first word out of his mouth.
String.Dest: 你随便在哪个乌烟瘴气的“雪鼠窝”都能找到他，而且他绝对一开口就会提我的名字。

String.Source: This Breton's name, is it by chance Edwayne?
String.Dest: 这个布莱顿人会不会就是艾德维?

String.Source: How should I know? He told it to me once, shouted it at me really, but I couldn't be bothered to remember such an insignificant detail.
String.Dest: 我怎么知道？他告诉过我，它其实是冲着我喊，但我不想记住这样一个无关紧要的细节。

String.Source: What's this Breton's name?
String.Dest: 这个布莱顿人叫什么名字？

String.Source: You'll likely find him wherever it is filthy skeevers like to congregate, and my name will most assuredly be the first word out of his mouth.
String.Dest: 你随便在哪个乌烟瘴气的“雪鼠窝”都能找到他，而且他绝对一开口就会提我的名字。

String.Source: What's this Breton's name?
String.Dest: 这个布莱顿人叫什么名字？

String.Source: That's enough about your duels with the Breton.
String.Dest: 你与那个布莱顿的决斗就到此为止吧。

String.Source: Indeed. Again, you're better off asking him. If we both stay at this inn long enough, you might be unlucky enough to meet him.
String.Dest: 确实如此。再说一次，你最好去问他。我们要是在这旅馆呆得久一点，也许你会攒够霉运来遇见他。

String.Source: A Warrior's Life.
String.Dest: 《战士的一生》

String.Source: Ah, a good request.
String.Dest: 啊，这个曲子点得好。

String.Source: With Bells On.
String.Dest: 【准备玩儿个痛快吧。/痛快挥洒（歌名）】

String.Source: Ah, a good request.
String.Dest: 啊，这个曲子点得好。

String.Source: Eyldi the Bear.
String.Dest: 狗熊艾迪。

String.Source: An excellent request.
String.Dest: 不错的请求。

String.Source: Tears of the Hist.
String.Dest: 希斯之泪

String.Source: Right, that's a new one. I heard it's another one of Fjona's. Naturally, I can play just as well.
String.Dest: 对，这是个新人。我听费欧娜说的是另一个。当然，我也演奏也无所谓。

String.Source: Dusk on Anvil Harbor.
String.Dest: 铁砧港的黄昏。

String.Source: The song that stole the heart and jewels of the Jarl of Markarth. I can play that for you.
String.Dest: 这首关于马卡斯城领主的心连同他的珠宝一起被偷走的歌曲，我可以演奏给你听。

String.Source: An excellent request.
String.Dest: 不错的请求。

String.Source: Let's make this place more lively. Mogo's Mead.
String.Dest: 让我们把这儿搞得热闹点。莫格蜜酒。

String.Source: Of course you would. Tell me, with what song shall I escort you to the heavens?
String.Dest: 你当然会。告诉我吧，我该用什么乐曲来护送你进入天堂？

String.Source: I'd like to make a request.
String.Dest: 我想要点歌。

String.Source: Of course you would. Tell me, with what song shall I escort you to the heavens?
String.Dest: 你当然会。告诉我吧，我该用什么乐曲来护送你进入天堂？

String.Source: I'd like to make a request.
String.Dest: 我想要点歌。

String.Source: Ask me again when I'm not on my break.
String.Dest: 等我没在休息的时候再来问问。

String.Source: I'd like to make a request.
String.Dest: 我想要点歌。

String.Source: I just sat down. Ask me again when I'm not on my break.
String.Dest: 我才刚刚坐下而已，等我没再休息的时候再来问我。

String.Source: I'd like to make a request.
String.Dest: 我想要点歌。

String.Source: The Breton. We killed him. Remember.
String.Dest: 那个布莱顿人。我们杀了他。记好了。

String.Source: Oh, right. Like I was saying, the Breton was more of an annoyance, like a hangnail or an itchy beard. Hardly worth my time, dead or alive.
String.Dest: 哦，好吧，我说过的，布莱顿人总是像根儿倒刺或者胡茬般那样惹人嫌。不管死活都不值得我浪费时间。

String.Source: The Breton. We killed him. Remember.
String.Dest: 那个布莱顿人。我们杀了他。记好了。

String.Source: Of more importance is that visiting the college has reminded me how I am head and shoulders above any bard in Skyrim.
String.Dest: 最重要的是，拜访学院提醒了我，在天际省的吟游诗人中我是多么的无与伦比。

String.Source: The Breton. We killed him. Remember.
String.Dest: 那个布莱顿人。我们杀了他。记好了。

String.Source: As a matter of fact, I am more than a bard. I am a skald. And I would like it if you referred to me as such from now on.
String.Dest: As a matter of fact, I am more than a bard. I am a skald. And I would like it if you referred to me as such from now on.

String.Source: You there, heed my request. It'll only take a moment of your time, for what I ask, I ask plain.
String.Dest: 你好，请听听我的请求吧。这只会耽误你一点点时间，因为我的要求，真的，真的很简单。

String.Source: If you're a bard, for your own sake, do not sing. For your voice cannot compare to mine.
String.Dest: 如果你是一个吟游诗人。为了你自己着想，还是不要唱歌的好。因为你的歌声无法和我相媲美。

String.Source: You do sound and speak like a highborn.
String.Dest: 你的谈吐看起来就像是出身名门。.

String.Source: I was afraid as much. One cannot hide who he truly is. Nobles, Thanes, Jarls, these are sorts of people I consider my peers.
String.Dest: 我也一样害怕。一个人无法隐藏他真正的本质。贵族，男爵，领主，我把这些人视为自己的同类。

String.Source: You sound like a noble, but you stink like a gutter rat.
String.Dest: 听你说的话像是一个高尚的人，但你恶心的像阴沟老鼠。

String.Source: Undoubtedly, these snot-bearing rags have collected their fair share of slime, but I've received no complaints from the company I've sought.
String.Dest: Undoubtedly, these snot-bearing rags have collected their fair share of slime, but I've received no complaints from the company I've sought.

String.Source: That would be him.
String.Dest: 那就是他了。

String.Source: Well, don't do something stupid and tell him where I am. I want nothing to do with the little goblin.
String.Dest: 好吧，别做蠢事，只要告诉他我在哪就可以了。我不会对那只矮个子哥布林动手的。

String.Source: I'd rather stick a hot poker in my ear than hear you speak another word.
String.Dest: 听你说话比还不如往我耳朵里插烙铁.

String.Source: (Sigh) Another poor, jealous soul, envious of my timbre. How it must pain you to not be me.
String.Dest: (叹气) 另一个穷人，嫉妒的灵魂，嫉妒我的音色。因为你不能成为我这让你如此痛苦。

String.Source: I'd rather stick a hot poker in my ear than hear you speak another word.
String.Dest: 听你说话比还不如往我耳朵里插烙铁.

String.Source: (Sigh) You hide your love with contempt, but I know you've been bewitched by my timbre. How it must pain you not to be in my arms.
String.Dest: （叹气）你用轻蔑掩饰着你的爱意，但我知道已经被我的音色迷住了。你不能依偎在我的怀里是多么痛苦啊。

String.Source: You appear to be an accomplished fighter. Care to share any tips?
String.Dest: 看来你是个相当老练的战士。可以给点建议吗？

String.Source: If you want to be a great fighter, I only have one tip. Be me. Since that is impossible, instructing you would be a waste of both our time.
String.Dest: 如果你想成为一个伟大的战士，我只有一个建议。那就是——成为我。既然这是不可能的，你就别浪费我俩的时间了。

String.Source: You appear to be an accomplished fighter. Care to share any tips?
String.Dest: 看来你是个相当老练的战士。可以给点建议吗？

String.Source: I don't mean it as an insult regarding your ability, just a matter of praise for mine. Some people take it the wrong way, however.
String.Dest: 我没有侮辱你才能的意思，只是夸奖我自己罢了。然而，总有些人喜欢误解。

String.Source: You appear to be an accomplished fighter. Care to share any tips?
String.Dest: 看来你是个相当老练的战士。可以给点建议吗？

String.Source: Foremost among them was that Breton Imp.
String.Dest: 我主要说的是那个布莱顿人小屁孩。

String.Source: There's nothing special about your voice.
String.Dest: 你的嗓音没啥特别的。

String.Source: You say that because you have yet to hear me sing. Once you do, my voice will echo in your mind to the distraction of all other thoughts.
String.Dest: 你说这些是因为你已经听我唱歌了。一旦你这么做了，我的声音会回荡在你的脑海里，分散一切杂念。

String.Source: We could just kill Edwayne right here.
String.Dest: 我们在这儿解决了艾德维就好 。

String.Source: If that's what you want. In all honesty, I don't care what in Ysmir's beard you do with him.
String.Dest: If that's what you want. In all honesty, I don't care what in Ysmir's beard you do with him.

String.Source: We could just kill Edwayne right here.
String.Dest: 我们在这儿解决了艾德维就好 。

String.Source: The Breton means as much to me as a cave rat means to a mountain lion.
String.Dest: 那些布莱顿人对于我来说就像穴鼠对于一头山狮一样。

String.Source: We could just kill Edwayne right here.
String.Dest: 我们在这儿解决了艾德维就好 。

String.Source: Ultimately, it's your decision. You give the order, I'll spray the blood.
String.Dest: 基本上，这是你的决定。你发布施令，我会为你赴汤蹈火。

String.Source: Your profession suits you. Better you sing about wars than fight them.
String.Dest: 你的职业很适合你歌颂战争而不是投入其中.

String.Source: You're wrong. I wasn't always a handsome bard. I used to be a handsome adventurer, and before that I was just handsome.
String.Dest: 你错了。我并不一直是个英俊的吟游诗人的。我曾经是一个英俊的冒险家，在那之前我只是个英俊的普通人。

String.Source: Your profession suits you. Better you sing about wars than fight them.
String.Dest: 你的职业很适合你歌颂战争而不是投入其中.

String.Source: Unfortunately, my adventuring days came to an end after I nearly lost my life in a scuffle with a group of bandits known as the Silver Hand.
String.Dest: 不幸的是，我在与一群被称为银手的强盗发生了一场混战之后，险些丢掉了小命。我的冒险生涯也因此结束了。

String.Source: Your profession suits you. Better you sing about wars than fight them.
String.Dest: 你的职业很适合你歌颂战争而不是投入其中.

String.Source: After that, I figured it wasn't worth it. Sure, I was a damn good fighter, the best, but I was damn near good at everything else too.
String.Dest: 在那之后，我发现那并不值得。没错，作为战士来说我实在太特么厉害了，我是最厉害的那个，不仅如此，就算是在别的领域，我也特么的堪称完美。

String.Source: Your profession suits you. Better you sing about wars than fight them.
String.Dest: 你的职业很适合你歌颂战争而不是投入其中.

String.Source: I owed it to this world to keep me alive. I can't even begin to imagine what sort of daedric nightmare Skyrim would be if I didn't exist.
String.Dest: 这是我欠这个养育我的世界的债。无法想象没有我存在的话天际会变成怎样的一场魔族噩梦。

String.Source: Yes, let's take a break.
String.Dest: 对，让我们休息一下。

String.Source: I'm glad we understand each other.
String.Dest: 我很高兴我们能彼此理解。

String.Source: Who is this Breton?
String.Dest: 这个布莱顿人是谁？

String.Source: He's an old acquaintance of mine. Joined up with the wolf hunters just so he could have a chance to kill me. Ha! As if I could be killed!
String.Dest: 他是我的一个老相识。加入了狩狼者，以为这样就可以有机会干掉我。哈！就好像我会被杀似的！

String.Source: Who is this Breton?
String.Dest: 这个布莱顿人是谁？

String.Source: In fact, the little carrot-licker's been trying to kill me for more than a dozen years now, back when my balls had more fur than his chin.
String.Dest: 事实上，十几年前，一根小胡萝卜刺想弄死我，因为我蛋上的毛儿比他下巴上的还多。

String.Source: I want to hear that song about the Civil War.
String.Dest: 我想听那首唱内战的歌。

String.Source: Sorry, but I don't play political songs. Oppression, Aggression, the whole thing's just a sordid mess.
String.Dest: 抱歉，我可不唱政治歌曲。什么压迫啊，侵略啊，都是些扯淡的玩意儿。

String.Source: So the entire tavern got into it.
String.Dest: 然后整个酒馆都卷进去了？

String.Source: Indeed. Pretty soon the whole place is in all out brawl. That's when I felt a tap on the shoulder. My instincts were to turn and duck.
String.Dest: 的确。很快整个地方的人都掐起来了。那时我感觉肩膀被谁拍了一下。我本能的转身并躲开了。

String.Source: So the entire tavern got into it.
String.Dest: 然后整个酒馆都卷进去了？

String.Source: Too bad the Breton was aiming for my neck. The little imp ended up shaving my scalp.
String.Dest: 糟糕的是那个布莱顿人要取我的项上人头。那个小鬼最终差点得了手。

String.Source: So the entire tavern got into it.
String.Dest: 然后整个酒馆都卷进去了？

String.Source: How much did you pay those Elves to start this, I asked him. He said he didn't have to pay them anything.
String.Dest: How much did you pay those Elves to start this, I asked him. He said he didn't have to pay them anything.

String.Source: So the entire tavern got into it.
String.Dest: 然后整个酒馆都卷进去了？

String.Source: When he told them the plan was to kill me, he said they offered to do it for free! An obvious lie, of course.
String.Dest: 当他告诉他们的计划是杀了我时，他说他们愿意免费这么做！当然这明显是一个谎言。

String.Source: What happened next?
String.Dest: 接下来发生了什么？

String.Source: Pretty soon the whole place is in all out brawl. That's when I felt a tap on the shoulder. My instincts were to turn and duck.
String.Dest: 很快地整个地方充满了纷乱。 这时我彷佛感觉到了什麽,我的直觉告诉我该转身离开。

String.Source: What happened next?
String.Dest: 接下来发生了什么？

String.Source: Too bad the Breton was aiming for my neck. The little imp ended up shaving my scalp.
String.Dest: 糟糕的是那个布莱顿人要取我的项上人头。那个小鬼最终差点得了手。

String.Source: What happened next?
String.Dest: 接下来发生了什么？

String.Source: How much did you pay those Elves to start this, I asked him. He said he didn't have to pay them anything.
String.Dest: How much did you pay those Elves to start this, I asked him. He said he didn't have to pay them anything.

String.Source: What happened next?
String.Dest: 接下来发生了什么？

String.Source: When he told them the plan was to kill me, he said they offered to do it for free! An obvious lie, of course.
String.Dest: 当他告诉他们的计划是杀了我时，他说他们愿意免费这么做！当然这明显是一个谎言。

String.Source: A knife fight seems like it would be hard to forget.
String.Dest: 兵戎相见，应该会成为一段难忘的回忆。

String.Source: Yes, perhaps I do recall some of it. It was in Riften I think, at the turn of the century, on the eve of the New Life Festival.
String.Dest: 是的，或许我确实想起了点什么。我想那是在裂谷城吧，在那世纪之交的时刻，在新生节前的那个夜晚。

String.Source: A knife fight seems like it would be hard to forget.
String.Dest: 兵戎相见，应该会成为一段难忘的回忆。

String.Source: We were all in a drunken revelry, when these two Elves got in an argument because one of them refused to dance with the other's sister.
String.Dest: 我们当时都在参加一场酒会，有两个精灵吵起来了，原因是一个不肯跟另一个的妹妹跳舞。

String.Source: A knife fight seems like it would be hard to forget.
String.Dest: 兵戎相见，应该会成为一段难忘的回忆。

String.Source: Then the one Elf says to the other, "If your sister looks anything like you, I'd rather bed an Orc!"
String.Dest: 然后一个精灵对其他人说，“如果你姐姐看起来跟你一样，我宁愿去睡一个兽人！”

String.Source: A knife fight seems like it would be hard to forget.
String.Dest: 兵戎相见，应该会成为一段难忘的回忆。

String.Source: Then an Orc woman rises from her chair, and yells some sort of curse before smashing a flagon across his nose.
String.Dest: 这个女兽人从椅子上站起来，把酒壶狠狠砸向他的鼻子，然后大声咒骂。

String.Source: Oh? Was he short, ugly, and green with envy?
String.Dest: 哦？他又矮又丑，眼睛因嫉妒而发绿吗？

String.Source: I think I met your Breton friend.
String.Dest: 我像我见过你的布莱顿朋友了。

String.Source: Can you blame him? How many people stare their own death in the face and manage not to soil themselves?
String.Dest: 你能责备他吗? 有多少人能面不改色的直面死亡，而非被吓尿了裤子？

String.Source: Well, that was eventful. Edwayne was not pleased to see you. At all.
String.Dest: 呃，那挺重要的。艾德维根本不喜欢看见你。

String.Source: In fact, I think he'll be heading over to Radiant Raiment any time now for a new robe.
String.Dest: 事实上，我想他现在为了一件新的法袍，恨不得无时无刻不往锦衣那儿钻。

String.Source: Well, that was eventful. Edwayne was not pleased to see you. At all.
String.Dest: 呃，那挺重要的。艾德维根本不喜欢看见你。

String.Source: Of course, he wasn't the only bard in there who soiled themselves. No, I reckon some of the ladies will need to change their britches as well.
String.Dest: 当然啦，他并不是唯一一个在那里得上花柳病的吟游诗人。不，我估摸着有些女孩儿也要换掉她们的裤子才好。

String.Source: Well, that was eventful. Edwayne was not pleased to see you. At all.
String.Dest: 呃，那挺重要的。艾德维根本不喜欢看见你。

String.Source: You haven't been listening to a word I've said, have you? Not to worry, it happens. You were obviously distracted by my charm.
String.Dest: 你根本没听我说，对吗？别着急，就是那样。你已经完全被我的魅力给分了神。

String.Source: It's done. The Breton's dead. How does it feel?
String.Dest: 搞定了，那个布莱顿人死了。感觉如何？

String.Source: Such is the spell this countenance casts on all mortals. But I swear to you, this is no mage's trick. There is no potion for this kind of handsome.
String.Dest: 这是将我的脸投影给所有凡人看的法术。但我向你发誓，它可不是法师的把戏。他们那儿没有这种能让人变帅气的药水。

String.Source: It's done. The Breton's dead. How does it feel?
String.Dest: 搞定了，那个布莱顿人死了。感觉如何？

String.Source: In any event, what were we talking about?
String.Dest: 无所谓了。我们刚刚在说什么……？

String.Source: It's done. The Breton's dead. How does it feel?
String.Dest: 搞定了，那个布莱顿人死了。感觉如何？

String.Source: Why do you think that is?
String.Dest: 为什么你会那样想？

String.Source: It never used to be a problem, but now that I hunt for flesh instead of blood, Hircine seems to have altered the nature of my curse.
String.Dest: 这根本不是什么问题，但现在我猎取的仅仅是香软的胴体，而非想要制造杀戮。海尔辛似乎改变了我身上诅咒的本质。

String.Source: Why do you think that is?
String.Dest: 为什么你会那样想？

String.Source: In any case, I wonder if you managed to kill a troublesome little Breton man amongst those Silver Hand.
String.Dest: 无论如何，我想知道你愿不愿意杀掉一个藏在那些银手之中的让人讨厌的小布莱顿人。

String.Source: Actually, the Silver Hand is finished. I finished them.
String.Dest: 实际上，白银之手已经完蛋了，我解决了他们。

String.Source: Then you saved me the trouble and them the humiliation. Against the likes of you, I'm assuming they at least managed to put up a fight.
String.Dest: 你帮我解决了麻烦，也帮助他们结束了屈辱的一生。和你这样的人为敌，我还以为他们至少能反抗一下呢。

String.Source: Actually, the Silver Hand is finished. I finished them.
String.Dest: 实际上，白银之手已经完蛋了，我解决了他们。

String.Source: And while their women must lament the fact that I wasn't there to ravage them, it's probably better this way. The tavern wench, you see, did not lie.
String.Dest: 到那时，他们的女人一定会为我并不想要蹂躏她们的事实而恸哭不已，这也许是最好的方法。要知道，那个酒馆女侍可没撒谎。

String.Source: Actually, the Silver Hand is finished. I finished them.
String.Dest: 实际上，白银之手已经完蛋了，我解决了他们。

String.Source: I do indeed have a problem controlling my transformations, but only when I lie with a woman.
String.Dest: 的的确确有个小问题控制着我的变化，但也只是当我身边躺着个女人的时候。

String.Source: The Silver Hand wouldn't fall to one who spits bread crumbs when he speaks.
String.Dest: 白银之手就不会无理到人他讲话时吐面包屑.

String.Source: Your words can mock me, but your cowardly face serves as its own retort. Of course, you can try to change it, but it will do no good.
String.Dest: 你说的话可以嘲弄我，但是你没发现你懦弱的脸在反驳你么？当然你可以试着去做些改变，反正也于事无补。

String.Source: The Silver Hand wouldn't fall to one who spits bread crumbs when he speaks.
String.Dest: 白银之手就不会无理到人他讲话时吐面包屑.

String.Source: You can narrow your eyes and bare your teeth, but you forget I am a bard, and I can hear the subtle trill in your voice.
String.Dest: 你可以眯起你的眼睛，露出你的牙齿，但是你忘了我是一个吟游诗人，我可以从你的嗓音中听到最细微的颤音。

String.Source: The Silver Hand wouldn't fall to one who spits bread crumbs when he speaks.
String.Dest: 白银之手就不会无理到人他讲话时吐面包屑.

String.Source: It tells me you are afraid, but considering how magnificent I am, you have every reason to be.
String.Dest: 这告诉我你在害怕，但考虑到我有多伟大，你会这样做也不足为奇。

String.Source: The Silver Hand wouldn't fall to one who spits bread crumbs when he speaks.
String.Dest: 白银之手就不会无理到人他讲话时吐面包屑.

String.Source: You remind me of that poor Breton Imp.
String.Dest: 你让我想起那个白痴布莱顿人了。

String.Source: I get it. You're tired. But this is no time to rest.
String.Dest: 我了解了。你现在很困。但是没时间去休息了。

String.Source: Then my next poem will be about an unruly taskmaster, who killed the only companion who ever liked him.
String.Dest: 那么我的下一首诗歌将会讲述一个无法无天的工头的故事，他把唯一喜欢过他的那个同伴给杀了。

String.Source: I get it. You're tired. But this is no time to rest.
String.Dest: 我了解了。你现在很困。但是没时间去休息了。

String.Source: Then my next poem will be about an unruly taskmaster, who killed the only companion who ever liked her.
String.Dest: 然后呢，我的下一首诗将会是关于一个不守规矩的工头，她把唯一喜欢过她的那个同伴给杀了。

String.Source: What makes this town different?
String.Dest: 是什么让这小镇与众不同？

String.Source: I'm only still here because the ladies have proven difficult to woo. Of course, I'll have to leave eventually, when the Breton shows up.
String.Dest: 我还在这儿的唯一原因就是那些女士们天生就是是很难追到手的。当然，那个布莱顿人出现的时候我还是不得不离开了。

String.Source: As a Companion, your secret's safe with me.
String.Dest: 身为战友团的成员，我会替你保守好秘密的。

String.Source: I see. Then you understand my predicament. Maybe you have a little fur in your ears as well.
String.Dest: 我明白了。这下你也理解我的处境了。你该不会跟我一样也是狼人吧。

String.Source: As a Companion, your secret's safe with me.
String.Dest: 身为战友团的成员，我会替你保守好秘密的。

String.Source: The tavern wench, you see, did not lie. I do indeed have a problem controlling my transformations, but only when I lie with a woman.
String.Dest: 你看，那个酒馆女侍其实并没有撒谎。我确实在控制变形方面有点问题，不过只在在我和女人睡的时候。

String.Source: As a Companion, your secret's safe with me.
String.Dest: 身为战友团的成员，我会替你保守好秘密的。

String.Source: It never used to be a problem, but now that I hunt for flesh instead of blood, Hircine seems to have altered the nature of my curse.
String.Dest: 这根本不是什么问题，但现在我猎取的仅仅是香软的胴体，而非想要制造杀戮。海尔辛似乎改变了我身上诅咒的本质。

String.Source: As a Companion, your secret's safe with me.
String.Dest: 身为战友团的成员，我会替你保守好秘密的。

String.Source: I never hurt any of them, but it does make for an awkward morning. I usually end up having to flee town to escape the gibbet.
String.Dest: 我从未伤害过他们任何一个人，但那确实让早晨变得尴尬无比。而到头来我都得仓皇逃离城镇，以避免被绞死。

String.Source: If you want to sit down just say so.
String.Dest: 想坐下你就说.

String.Source: I think I just did.
String.Dest: 我觉得我就刚做了。

String.Source: Never mind. Is there anything else you want to do while we're in town?
String.Dest: 别担心。当我们到城里时你还有别的事想要做吗？

String.Source: No, coming to the college was enough. It has opened my eyes. Just when I thought I couldn't get any more amazing.
String.Dest: 不，能够到学院来已经足够了。在我以为这世上已经没有新奇事物的时候，学院开阔了我的视野。

String.Source: Never mind. Is there anything else you want to do while we're in town?
String.Dest: 别担心。当我们到城里时你还有别的事想要做吗？

String.Source: As of this day, I am more than a bard. I am a skald. And I would like it if you referred to me as such from now on.
String.Dest: 我不仅仅是一个吟游诗人。我是一名战地诗人。并且我希望你从今以后能如此称呼我。

String.Source: {Lute - Medley}
String.Dest: {鲁特琴混奏}

String.Source: {Lute - Medley}
String.Dest: {鲁特琴混奏}

String.Source: {Flute - Medley}
String.Dest: {长笛- 集成曲}

String.Source: {Flute - Medley}
String.Dest: {长笛- 集成曲}

String.Source: {Flute - Medley}
String.Dest: {长笛- 集成曲}

String.Source: {Flute - Medley}
String.Dest: {长笛- 集成曲}

String.Source: {Flute - Medley}
String.Dest: {长笛- 集成曲}

String.Source: {Lute - Dragonborn Comes}
String.Dest: {鲁特琴——《龙裔来了》}

String.Source: {Lute - Portraiture}
String.Dest: {Lute - Portraiture}

String.Source: {Lute - Wolves of Jorrvaskr}
String.Dest: {鲁特琴 -月瓦斯卡群狼}

String.Source: {Lute - The Journey}
String.Dest: {Lute - The Journey}

String.Source: {Lute - The Journey}
String.Dest: {Lute - The Journey}

String.Source: [Drums]
String.Dest: [鼓曲]

String.Source: Our hero, our hero, claims a warrior's heart! I tell you, I tell you, the Dragonborn comes;
String.Dest: 【原版歌词替换】英雄，英雄，勇者无惧。我告诉你，我告诉你，龙裔已降临。

String.Source: With a Voice wielding power of the ancient Nord art; Believe, believe the Dragornborn comes;
String.Dest: 【歌词待校对】诺德技艺，龙吼回归。没错，没错，他是龙裔。

String.Source: It's an end to the evil, of all Skyrim's foes; Beware, beware the Dragonborn comes;
String.Dest: 终结邪恶，敌人的末日。当心，当心，龙裔出世。

String.Source: For the darkness has passed and the legend yet grows; You'll know, you'll know the Dragonborn comes.
String.Dest: 【歌词待校对】黑暗消逝，传奇之曲正在编织。你会发现，你会发现，龙裔已降临。

String.Source: Farewell.
String.Dest: 再会。

String.Source: Goodbye.
String.Dest: 再见。

String.Source: Until next time.
String.Dest: 下回见。

String.Source: All right, then.
String.Dest: 那就这样吧。

String.Source: About time.
String.Dest: 是时候了。

String.Source: Well, hello hello.
String.Dest: 好吧，你好。

String.Source: Maybe you and I can get to know each other better. What do you say?
String.Dest: 或许我们能更好的互相了解对方，你怎么看?

String.Source: Ugh, yeah, what do you want?
String.Dest: 嗯，是的，你想要什么？

String.Source: Yes?
String.Dest: 什么？

String.Source: What is it?
String.Dest: 什么？

String.Source: Mm...yeah?
String.Dest: 恩……干啥？

String.Source: Greetings.
String.Dest: 你好。

String.Source: Make it quick.
String.Dest: 快点好吗？

String.Source: Something on your mind?
String.Dest: 你有什么心事吗？

String.Source: Something on your mind?
String.Dest: 有什么想法？

String.Source: If your problem is uncontrollable desire, then yes, I am.
String.Dest: 如果困扰你的问题是无法控制的欲望，那么对了，我也是。

String.Source: You know what your problem is, Gilsi?
String.Dest: 已经认识到自己的错误了吗，歌尔西?

String.Source: Wait here.
String.Dest: 在这里等着。

String.Source: Wait here for a moment.
String.Dest: 在这儿等一下。

String.Source: Take your time. I'll just sit here and compose a tune that'll make me the wealthiest man in Skyrim.
String.Dest: 别着急，我会在这坐着创作一首能让我成为天际省最有钱的人的曲子。

String.Source: Follow me.
String.Dest: 跟我走。

String.Source: You're the boss. But only because I allow it.
String.Dest: 你是老大。那也是大爷我批准的。

String.Source: Alas, it's time for us to part ways.
String.Dest: 行啦，是咱们分道扬镳的时候啦。

String.Source: {Departs}
String.Dest: {离开 }

String.Source: Alas, it's time for us to part ways.
String.Dest: 行啦，是咱们分道扬镳的时候啦。

String.Source: Did I ever tell you I could read the future? It involves me, three wenches, four beers and a little inn by a bridge. I'll be there if you need me.
String.Dest: 我告诉过你我能预知未来吗？那涉及到了我，三个女侍，四瓶啤酒，和一个临桥的小酒馆儿。如果你需要我的话就来这里找我。

String.Source: It's nothing. Never mind.
String.Dest: 没什么事，不用担心。

String.Source: That was a waste of time.
String.Dest: 这只是在浪费时间。

String.Source: Yes. Let me show you.
String.Dest: 不错，你看看。

String.Source: Sure.
String.Dest: 当然。

String.Source: Hurry up.
String.Dest: 快点儿。

String.Source: Sure you do. Everyone needs me.
String.Dest: 当然啦。每个人都需要我。

String.Source: I need you to do something for me.
String.Dest: 我需要你为我做件事情。

String.Source: Sure. Take it all. I'll do the same for the wenches.
String.Dest: Sure. Take it all. I'll do the same for the wenches.

String.Source: I need to trade some things with you.
String.Dest: 我想跟你交易一些东西。

String.Source: Sure, but do you mind taking some of this ore? It's not that I lack the strength, it's more that I lack the will.
String.Dest: Sure, but do you mind taking some of this ore? It's not that I lack the strength, it's more that I lack the will.

String.Source: I need to trade some things with you.
String.Dest: 我想跟你交易一些东西。

String.Source: I once traded a poem for a scabbard. Of course, the girl didn't own a sword.
String.Dest: I once traded a poem for a scabbard. Of course, the girl didn't own a sword.

String.Source: I need to trade some things with you.
String.Dest: 我想跟你交易一些东西。

String.Source: Got any ale or mead?
String.Dest: 有酒或肉吗？

String.Source: I need to trade some things with you.
String.Dest: 我想跟你交易一些东西。

String.Source: Equipment check is it? All right.
String.Dest: Equipment check is it? All right.

String.Source: I need to trade some things with you.
String.Dest: 我想跟你交易一些东西。

String.Source: Sure.
String.Dest: 当然。

String.Source: Mm...yeah.
Zzzzz...
String.Dest: Zzzzz……

String.Source: Caves are like a bandit's feet. Dank and covered in fungus.
String.Dest: Caves are like a bandit's feet. Dank and covered in fungus.

String.Source: You know what I hate about bandits? Most of them savages don't even give you the option of handing over your coin purse. Not that I would.
String.Dest: 你知道我讨厌强盗的什么吗？他们中的绝大多数野蛮到甚至不给你把钱财交出来的选项。虽说就算给了我也不会老实交钱。

String.Source: The Dwemer don't seem like a musical race. Where are the metal instruments? The machine flutes? The steam powered organs?
String.Dest: 看来矮人不是个爱好音乐的种族啊。金属乐器在哪里？机械笛子有吗？蒸汽驱动风琴来一台呗？

String.Source: Ever see a Dwemer machine sort of bunch itself into a sphere? The only other time I saw something shrink like that was when I imagined Faida naked.
String.Dest: Ever see a Dwemer machine sort of bunch itself into a sphere? The only other time I saw something shrink like that was when I imagined Faida naked.

String.Source: Necromancers, warlocks, dark mages...I just don't get that sort of lifestyle.
String.Dest: 亡灵巫师，召唤术士，黑魔法师……我真是没法理解他们那种生活方式。

String.Source: Have you ever had that feeling where you think something's about to go horribly wrong? Well, I just had it thinking about this lair.
String.Dest: 你有过到了某处之后感觉有什么糟糕的事情要发生的情况吗？呃，我刚刚对着这个巢穴就在犯嘀咕。

String.Source: I've seen Solitude and now I've seen Windhelm. Both are majestic, both pale in comparison to me.
String.Dest: 我已经见识过了独孤城而我现在见到了风盔城。他们都很雄伟，虽然跟我比起来都很苍白。

String.Source: So has Ysolda bought The Bannered Mare yet? Somehow, I don't think Hulda means it when she says she's going to sell.
String.Dest: 伊索尔达买下母马横幅了吗？不管怎么说，我觉得胡尔达说她要卖掉这家酒馆的时候没什么诚意呀。

String.Source: Must be hard to be a Draugr. Drink a pint a mead and the stuff will just spill on the floor.
String.Dest: 这对尸鬼来说肯定很难。想喝一品脱的麦芽酒，结果却会通通洒在地上。

String.Source: When the Breton and I crossed paths here, he insisted we duel with scrolls, in honor of the mages. Damn if either of us knew how to use one.
String.Dest: 当这个布莱顿人和我穿过这条小路的时候，他坚决要求我们用卷轴决斗，为了法师的荣耀。见鬼的我俩甚至压根儿不知道该怎么用。

String.Source: How many bloodsuckers does it take to cook beef stew? Two. One to cook it, and one to cure him of vampirism so he can add the garlic.
String.Dest: 几个吸血鬼可以做一顿红烩牛肉？两个。一个掌勺，还有一个得去治好掌勺那位的血热病，这样他才可以往红烩牛肉里加大蒜。

String.Source: The tavern wench here called me handsome. Looks like I won't be paying for my room tonight.
String.Dest: The tavern wench here called me handsome. Looks like I won't be paying for my room tonight.

String.Source: Dead Man's Drink. Corpselight Farm. Grave Concoctions. They should call the funeral home, "The Hall of the Living" just to screw with the townsfolk.
String.Dest: Dead Man's Drink. Corpselight Farm. Grave Concoctions. They should call the funeral home, "The Hall of the Living" just to screw with the townsfolk.

String.Source: It goes without saying that I don't like vampires. It's all part of the contract. You're okay though.
String.Dest: 不用说，我并不喜欢吸血鬼。这只是契约的一部分。不过你还好啦。

String.Source: It goes without saying that I don't like vampires. It's all part of the contract.
String.Dest: 不用说，我并不喜欢吸血鬼。这都是契约的一部分。

String.Source: The Reach, huh. You can't walk three feet here without stepping on a Breton. Hope you like duels.
String.Dest: 到瑞驰了，哼。在这里你不想跟布莱顿人过不去的话，那就寸步难行了。希望你喜欢决斗。

String.Source: I knew a fellow who got himself imprisoned in Cidhna mine. Grisvar the Unlucky, they called him. Bad name for a gambler, worse for a thief.
String.Dest: 我认识一个被囚禁在希讷矿坑的人。他们叫他，倒霉蛋格里斯瓦。对于一个赌徒来说这是个糟糕的称号，比“小偷”这个称号更糟糕。

String.Source: The Windpeak Inn has a damn fine bard. Not a great singer, but she has lots of energy, and lots of passion.
String.Dest: 在风岳旅店有一个好得不得了的吟游诗人。虽然她没有一个好嗓子，但她很有活力和激情。

String.Source: What are we doing here? We ought to head west to Solitude, that's where we'll find good food and beer.
String.Dest: 我们在这干嘛？ 我们应该向西去独孤城，在儿那我们能找到美食和美酒。

String.Source: The Bards College offers a formal education. It's like painting by numbers. No true bard, or skald for that matter, would dare learn that way.
String.Dest: 吟游诗人学院提供正式的教育。你这就像用数字画画。没有真正的诗人——或者在这里叫做吟游诗人——胆敢用那种方式来学习。

String.Source: I've heard of mages who use telekinises to strip off a woman's clothes. But who needs spells when you look like this?
String.Dest: I've heard of mages who use telekinises to strip off a woman's clothes. But who needs spells when you look like this?

String.Source: I left the Wolves, but if you want to swing by Jorrvaskr and pay your respects, fine. But let's stop by the Hall of the Dead too, so I can pay mine.
String.Dest: 我离开了狼群，但是如果你想经过月瓦斯卡表示你的尊敬，随你便。但是让我们在死者大厅这也停一下吧，让我也表达一下我的敬意。

String.Source: They say Eorlund Gray-Mane is the best smith in town. Of course, he's hardly the best looking. That honor goes to Miss Adrianne Avenicci.
String.Dest: 人们常说厄林迪尔·灰鬃是城里最好的铁匠。当然，他的外貌确实有些对不起观众。城里最美的铁匠是雅芝·阿文奇小萌妹。

String.Source: That impish looking fellow over there...something about him seems familiar...
String.Dest: 啊，那个淘气的小伙子！我好像在哪见过他……

String.Source: I once got in a quarrel with a bard here. It was over a woman, and I was drunk. Wasn't until the next day I realized the fish face wasn't worth it.
String.Dest: 我曾经因为一个女人而跟一个吟游诗人吵架，当时我还喝醉了。直到第二天我才明白那个死鱼脸不值得我跟那个诗人吵。

String.Source: When I taught Fjona the lute, she wanted to practice somewhere no one would hear her. I recommended The Drunken Huntsman.
String.Dest: 在我教费欧娜弹奏鲁特琴的时候，她想要找一个没人听得到的地方练习。于是我推荐她去酩酊猎手。

String.Source: Everyone here is so depressing. They need to look in the mirror and...well, that's it. Always cheers me up.
String.Dest: 这里的每个人都很沮丧。他们需要照照镜子，然后……呃，就是这样。这法子总能让我振作起来。

String.Source: Darkwater Crossing is famous for its hot springs. I prefer cold weather, but sometimes the wolf must go where the rabbits play to sate his hunger.
String.Dest: 黑水岔口以那里的温泉闻名。虽然我更喜欢寒冷的天气，但有时候饿狼也不得不跑到兔群栖息的地方以求得饱餐。

String.Source: Ivarstead. Skyrim's foremost tourist town.
String.Dest: 紫杉镇，天际省最棒的旅游城市。

String.Source: Ah, Markarth. Did I ever tell you about the night I spent "communing with Dibella." The wolf made an appearance thrice that evening.
String.Dest: 啊，马卡斯城。我告诉过你我“与迪贝拉亲密无间”的那个晚上吗，那晚这只狼出现了三次。

String.Source: Riften is where they make Black-Briar Mead, isn't it? I think we should stop by the brewery, see where the magic happens.
String.Dest: 裂谷城是出产黑荆棘蜜酒的地方，对不？我觉着我们应该在酿酒厂呆几天，瞧瞧那儿被施了什么魔法。

String.Source: Riften. Home of the Temple of Mara. Where happiness comes to die.
String.Dest: 裂谷城。玛拉神殿的所在地。一个能让你幸福得要死的地方。

String.Source: I don't understand why Draugr need to pretend they're asleep. It's not like they're going to get the jump on us.
String.Dest: 我不明白为什么尸鬼需要假装他们是已经睡着了。他们不像是会抢在我们之前行动的样子啊。

String.Source: Shame what happened to Kodlak Whitemane. Never liked the old wolf, but I damn sure respected him.
String.Dest: 我为克拉科身上发生的一切表示遗憾。我从来没喜欢过那头老狼，但我真的尊重他。

String.Source: This is a quaint little hamlet. I wonder if they have a bard.
String.Dest: 一个古雅的小村庄。我想知道他们这里有没有吟游诗人。

String.Source: Can't stand thieves. Scum of the land. Of course, bards are the most notorious thieves of all. Stealing a song is like stealing a man's soul.
String.Dest: 让人无法容忍的小偷，这片土地的败类。当然了，吟游诗人是天下最臭名昭着的贼。偷学一首歌就像偷走一个人的灵魂。

String.Source: Always wanted to sing "Ragnar the Red" here in Rorikstead. Just feels right.
String.Dest: 无论什么时候，在洛利克镇都可以高歌唱一曲“红衣拉格纳”。

String.Source: This town used to be filled with the bookish sort, come to study at the College. Good riddance. Why read when you can sing.
String.Dest: This town used to be filled with the bookish sort, come to study at the College. Good riddance. Why read when you can sing.

String.Source: The Eldergleam. When one comes across such an arresting beauty, words do not suffice. Now I why everyone I meet is at a loss for words.
String.Dest: 古藤圣所！当一个人面对如此有魄力的美丽，说什么也多余了。现在我知道为什么我遇见的每个人都词穷了。

String.Source: If you're unsure of where to go after this, I say we flip a coin. Heads we go to the tavern, tails we go to the tavern.
String.Dest: 如果你确定下面要去哪里, 我建议我们丢下硬币。正面我们去客栈，反面我们去客栈。

String.Source: I heard a rumor that every now and then, a wolf stops by the Bee and Barb to do a little howling. If it's Fjona, I wouldn't mind taking a listen.
String.Dest: 我听说一条狼时不时会在蜂与钩停下，然后嚎上几嗓子。如果那是费欧娜在叫，我可不会介意听上一会儿。

String.Source: The bandit lair was full of flair and no one cared how foul the air. What? Don't look at me like that, it's a work in progress.
String.Dest: 这个强盗老窝儿的选址太有才了，都没人会在乎那儿的空气到底有多污浊。什么？别那么看我，这只是一项进展中的工作罢了。

String.Source: Ever been in a cave with old Elven paintings on the wall? Me neither. Wonder why that is.
String.Dest: 就连山洞里的墙上都挂着古老的精灵绘画？我也一样不知道是为什么。

String.Source: That's your father talking. If he weren't around, every other word out of your mouth would be "Yes." The rest would be inaudible moans.
String.Dest: That's your father talking. If he weren't around, every other word out of your mouth would be "Yes." The rest would be inaudible moans.

String.Source: What, you mean singing? That comes after. First my lady, I require some inspiration. And no maiden here is more inspiring than you.
String.Dest: 什么，你是说唱歌？我的女士，首先呢，我需要一些灵感。而在座的女士里没有比您更适合给予我启发的了。

String.Source: Julienne, I've been looking for you. How about you and me steal away into one of those rooms for a bit?
String.Dest: 朱利安尼，我一直在找你呢。你能和我偷偷摸的进其中一个的房间吗？就一小会儿。

String.Source: Not many people can find the place, to be honest, since it's not on any map.
String.Dest: 说实话，没多少人能找到这个地方。因为那里在任何一份地图上都没有标示。

String.Source: How do you know the scene hasn't been tampered with?
String.Dest: 你们怎么能确保现在看到的这些没有被篡改过。

String.Source: The only reason the guard were able to arrest my father is because he was forced to spend the night in Solitude.
String.Dest: 守卫逮捕我父亲唯一可行的理由就是他非自愿而不得不在独孤城过了一夜。

String.Source: How do you know the scene hasn't been tampered with?
String.Dest: 你们怎么能确保现在看到的这些没有被篡改过。

String.Source: Didn't feel a thing!
String.Dest: 就像挠痒痒！

String.Source: Ugh!
String.Dest: 呃！

String.Source: It'll take a lot more than that to best me!
String.Dest: 那可比打败我要难得多得多了。

String.Source: Didn't feel a thing!
String.Dest: 就像挠痒痒！

String.Source: You hit like my sister!
String.Dest: 你还不如我妹妹能打！

String.Source: Agh, not the face!
String.Dest: 诶呀，认错人了！

String.Source: Come on, is that all you've got?
String.Dest: 来呀来呀，就这点本事吗？

String.Source: Do your worst!
String.Dest: 你这样还不够看！

String.Source: Ugh! You fiend!
String.Dest: Ugh! You fiend!

String.Source: Do your worst!
String.Dest: 你这样还不够看！

String.Source: Like the bite of a flea!
String.Dest: 就被跳蚤咬了一口！

String.Source: Enough! This ends now!
String.Dest: 够了！结束了！

String.Source: It'll take more than that!
String.Dest: 需要的比这更多！

String.Source: Aaaaayyargh!
String.Dest: 啊~~~咿呀！

String.Source: Eeeeyyargh!
String.Dest: 耶呀！

String.Source: Eyaargh!
String.Dest: 哎呀！

String.Source: Do me a favor and stand still!
String.Dest: 帮我个忙，站住！

String.Source: Die, damn you!
String.Dest: 去死吧，混蛋！

String.Source: I've had enough of you!
String.Dest: 我受够你了！

String.Source: Hyagh!
String.Dest: 哈啊！

String.Source: Stop running around you coward!
String.Dest: 站住，你个胆小鬼!

String.Source: You picked the wrong dinner, animal!
String.Dest: 你选错了晚餐，畜生！

String.Source: You're outmatched!
String.Dest: 你输了！

String.Source: You won't get away!
String.Dest: 你跑不了！

String.Source: Take that, you fiend!
String.Dest: 接招吧，你这恶魔！

String.Source: I'll have your head!
String.Dest: 我要取你的首级！

String.Source: It's time for your nap!
String.Dest: 午睡时间到！

String.Source: Fall to me, Giant!
String.Dest: Fall to me, Giant!

String.Source: Die, you wrinkled old hag!
String.Dest: Die, you wrinkled old hag!

String.Source: You don't want any part of this, Falmer!
